summary: This is a brief email exchange between FBI personnel regarding the transfer of a hard drive containing iPhone and iPad forensic reports to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The email is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Identified as the NY CART Coordinator and Senior Forensic Examiner who has a hard drive with iPhone and iPad reports ready for transfer to the Southern District.

persons.name: M, g (NY) (FBI) c
persons.context: The sender of the initial email offering to drop off a hard drive with forensic reports at the Southern District.

persons.name: (USANYS)
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York recipient
persons.context: The recipient of the email who agrees to accept the hard drive if dropped off at security and requests the reports be included in a spreadsheet.

connections.person2: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner
connections.description: Both are FBI personnel involved in the forensic examination and transfer of evidence related to the case.
FBI employee coordinating evidence transfer with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Forensic Evidence Transfer Coordination
events.description: FBI personnel coordinate the transfer of a hard drive containing iPhone and iPad forensic reports to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
personsInvolved: NY CART Coordinator Senior Forensic Examiner

locations: Southern District (likely referring to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: FBI forensic examiners had completed reports from iPhone and iPad devices relevant to the investigation.
A hard drive containing these forensic reports was being transferred to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in July 2020.
The email exchange is subject to a protective order, indicating the sensitive nature of the evidence.
The communication shows ongoing investigative activity and evidence handling between the FBI and prosecutors years after Epstein's arrest.
